moduleGroup.name: SVPASEG (Tissue Classification)
moduleGroup.description: This workflow segments a raw unskull stripped image into different tissue types.

module.name: Gamixture
module.description: Used for fitting the Finite Mixture Model to the image data using the genetic algorithms.

module.tag: FMM Finite Mixture Model Genetic algorithm

input.name: Input image file
input.description: Enter the MRI T1 image that is to be segmented.

input.name: Maskfile
input.description: Enter the Maskfile of the brain without the skull. This will be used to perform skull stripping. All voxels with the value greater than 0.5 (in the mask) are assumed to belong to the brain.

input.name: Atlasfile
input.description: This is the atlas specification file.

output.name: Output fmmparamfile
output.description: A file where the mixture parameters are written.

input.name: Unsigned
input.description: Specifying this option will assume that the data is unsigned.

input.name: Alpha
input.description: Parameter for blended crossover, defaults to 0.5.

input.name: Size
input.description: Population size, defaults to 100

input.name: Terminationthr
input.description: Threshold for terminating the algorithm, defaults to 0.0005

input.name: xoverrate
input.description: Crossover rate, defaults to 1

input.name: Maxgenerations
input.description: Maximum number of generations, defaults to 500

input.name: Sortpop
input.description: Whether to use the permutation operator, defaults to 1

input.name: Parzenn
input.description: Number of points for Parzen estimate (for approximate ML), defaults to 101

input.name: Parzensigma
input.description: Window width parameter for the Parzen estimate, defaults to 1.

input.name: Equalvar
input.description: Whether component densities should have equal variances, defaults to 0

input.name: Restarts
input.description: The number of individual runs of the GA, defaults to 10

dataModule.name: Atlas Specification File
dataModule.description: The Atlas specification files are used to input the information about SVPA, MRF and FMM constraints to the programs. The files that impose constraints to certain mixture components start with an identifier 'p', 'r' or 't'. P: svpaseg considers all the labels (pure and mixed) and reclassifies those voxels originally labeled as mixed voxels. r: svpaseg considers only pure labels during the tissue classification. t: svpaseg considers only pure labels during the tissue classification and uses tissue probability maps to aid the tissue classification.

output.name: Output
output.description: The Atlas specification files are used to input the information about SVPA, MRF and FMM constraints to the programs. The files that impose constraints to certain mixture components start with an identifier 'p', 'r' or 't'. P: svpaseg considers all the labels (pure and mixed) and reclassifies those voxels originally labeled as mixed voxels. r: svpaseg considers only pure labels during the tissue classification. t: svpaseg considers only pure labels during the tissue classification and uses tissue probability maps to aid the tissue classification.

module.name: SVPASEG
module.description: Brain tissue classification based on local Markov random fields and ICM algorithm..
module.license: http://www.loni.ucla.edu/Software/license.phpBy registering for downloads from the UCLA Laboratory of Neuro Imaging, you are agreeing to the following terms and conditions as well as to the Terms of Use of the LONI website. input.name: Input image file
input.description: Enter the MRI T1 image that is to be segmented.

input.name: Maskfile
input.description: Enter the Maskfile of the brain without the skull. This will be used to perform skull stripping. All voxels with the value greater than 0.5 (in the mask) are assumed to belong to the brain.

input.name: Atlasfile
input.description: This is the atlas specification file.

input.name: fmmparamfile
input.description: A mixture parameters file. Misture parameter file must match the atlas specification file.

input.name: Unsigned
input.description: Specifying this option will assume that the data is unsigned.

input.name: Beta1
input.description: Regularization parameter first first-order interactions, defaults depend on particular model setting. It is NOT recommended to change the defaults.

input.name: Beta2
input.description: Regularization parameter for second order interactions i.e. controls the strenght of the spatial regularization component. Defaults to 0.05

input.name: PVElabels
input.description: Controls whether intermediate PVE classification labels are written, not relevant except for p-type atlases.

output.name: Labelfile
output.description: This is the tissue classified image (only pure tissue types).

viewerModule.name: LONI Viewer
viewerModule.description:
This is a general, versatile and light-weight viewer, which allows visualzaition of:
1. Volumetric data parseable by the LONI Debabeler (http://www.loni.ucla.edu/Software/Debabeler)
2. Shape/Surface objects in any of the ShapeTools geometry shape formats (http://www.loni.ucla.edu/Software/ShapeTools).

filetype.name: MESH obj
filetype.description: A type of MESH obj file.

viewerModule.name: LONI Viewer
viewerModule.description:
This is a general, versatile and light-weight viewer, which allows visualzaition of:
1. Volumetric data parseable by the LONI Debabeler (http://www.loni.ucla.edu/Software/Debabeler)
2. Shape/Surface objects in any of the ShapeTools geometry shape formats (http://www.loni.ucla.edu/Software/ShapeTools).

filetype.name: MESH obj
filetype.description: A type of MESH obj file.

annotation.name: Estimation of image parameters by fitting FMMs to the image data using genetic algorithms.

style.name: Estimation of image parameters by fitting FMMs to the image data using genetic algorithms.$0

annotation.name: Parameters from the previous module are used to classify the voxels in a 3D image. Local Markov Random field theory is used to segment the brain image.

style.name: Parameters from the previous module are used to classify the voxels in a 3D image. Local Markov Random field theory is used to segment the brain image.$0

annotation.name: The Atlas specification files are used to input the information about the SVPA, MRF, FMM constraints to the programs. These files can be found at /usr/local/svpaseg-2.0_64bit/atlasspecs

style.name: The Atlas specification files are used to input the information about the SVPA, MRF, FMM constraints to the programs. These files can be found at /usr/local/svpaseg-2.0_64bit/atlasspecs $0
